laboratory_examinations.findings: Negative results for rubella virus, toxoplasma, HIV, hepatitis B, and C.
BPD 54 mm (< P10, -1.85 SD), HC 204 mm (< P10, -1.53 SD), AC 177 mm (< P10, -1.55 SD), FL 39 mm (P15.4, -1.02 SD). Cystic structures detected at posterior horn of lateral ventricles.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-up ultrasound at 28+1 weeks showed: BPD 63 mm (< P1, -2.64 SD), HC 232 mm (< P1, -2.99 SD), AC 205 mm (< P1, -2.56 SD), FL 46 mm (< P3, -1.94 SD). Persistent cystic structures with increased size.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Cystic structures around bilateral lateral ventricles, abnormal signal foci in the white matter of the right parietal lobe. Smaller diameters and sulci than normal.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-up MRI at 28+1 weeks showed mild dilation of the bilateral ventricles and cystic structures. Abnormal signal foci in the white matter and smaller brain diameter and sulcus development than normal fetuses.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Normal chromosome karyotype; CMA revealed a heterozygous deletion of 23.9 Mb in chromosome 5q11.1-q21.3 region.
Fetus carried the TREX1:NM_033629.6:exon2:c.294dup:p.C99Mfs*3 homozygous variant; both parents were heterozygous carriers.
